inclusion.criterion: Age above 18 years, male or female.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Serum alanine or asparate aminotransferase activities that are above the upper limit of normal (ALT greater than 41 or AST greater than 31 U/L) on an average of three determinations taken during the previous 6 months.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Presence of anti-HCV and HCV RNA in serum tested at least once during the previous six months.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Evidence of chronic hepatitis on liver biopsy done within the previous 12 months with a histology activity index of at least 6 (out of a maximum of 22).
inclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Decompensated liver disease, as marked by bilirubin greater than 4 mg%, albumin less than 3.0 gm%, prothrombin time greater than 2 sec prolonged, or history of bleeding esophageal varices, ascites or hepatic encephalopathy.
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Pregnancy or, in women of child-bearing potential or spouses of such women, inability to practice adequate contraception, defined as vasectomy in men, tubal ligation in women, or use of condoms and spermacide, or birth control pills, or an intrauterine device.
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Significant systemic or major illnesses other than liver disease, including congestive heart failure, renal failure (creatinine clearance less than 50 ml/min), organ transplantation, serious psychiatric disease or depression, and angina pectoris.
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Pre-existing anemia (hematocrit less than 36% for men and less than 34% for women) or known history of hemolytic anemia.
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Antiviral or immunosuppressive therapy within the last 6 months.
exclusion.label: not_met

notes: Patient has HCV cirrhosis, grade II esophageal varices, and recent admission for UGIB. He is being treated with lactulose for hepatic encephalopathy.
